segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome back to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎回到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: My name is Catherine, and today we're talking about buying clothes.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine，今天我们要讨论购买衣服。

segments.en: That's right, we're going to go and get some clothes, but on this occasion, we are going to get a suit, and we're going to have it made especially for us.
segments.cn: 没错，我们要去买一些衣服，但这次我们要定制一套西装，特别为我们制作。

segments.en: So before we get started, why don't we take a look at one keyword that we have in vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 在开始之前，我们先来看一个词汇预览中的关键词。

segments.en: Vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 词汇预览。

segments.en: Okay, this word makes me think of things that are very rich and soft.
segments.cn: 好的，这个词让我想到非常丰富和柔软的东西。

segments.en: It's a fabric, right?
segments.cn: 这是一种面料，对吗？

segments.en: That's right, it's a kind of textile.
segments.cn: 没错，这是一种纺织品。

segments.en: It's called cashmere.
segments.cn: 它叫做羊绒。

segments.en: Cashmere.
segments.cn: 羊绒。

segments.en: So maybe you've heard of cashmere wool.
segments.cn: 也许你听说过羊绒毛。

segments.en: It's a special kind of wool that comes from animals.
segments.cn: 这是一种来自动物的特殊毛料。

segments.en: So this is a textile or a fabric that is commonly used to make pants, nice pants, or suits for men.
segments.cn: 这是一种常用于制作裤子、漂亮的裤子或男士西装的纺织品。

segments.en: Or scarves or sweaters.
segments.cn: 或者围巾或毛衣。

segments.en: If you've ever had a cashmere sweater, you know it's very luxurious, very soft.
segments.cn: 如果你曾经拥有一件羊绒毛衣，你就知道它非常奢华，非常柔软。

segments.en: So it can be a little bit expensive depending on the quality.
segments.cn: 所以根据质量，它可能会有点贵。

segments.en: And that's what we're going to be looking at now.
segments.cn: 这就是我们现在要看的内容。

segments.en: We're going to be making a suit out of cashmere.
segments.cn: 我们将用羊绒制作一套西装。

segments.en: So why don't we listen to our dialogue for the first time.
segments.cn: 那么我们先听听我们的对话。

segments.en: Welcome to Bill's Fabric World.
segments.cn: 欢迎来到Bill的面料世界。

segments.en: What can I do for you today?
segments.cn: 今天我能为你做些什么？

segments.en: I was wondering if you guys also tailor clothes.
segments.cn: 我想知道你们是否也定制衣服。

segments.en: Sure we do.
segments.cn: 当然可以。

segments.en: We have the best tailors in the country.
segments.cn: 我们有全国最好的裁缝。

segments.en: What is it that you need exactly?
segments.cn: 你具体需要什么？

segments.en: Well, I'm looking to get a custom-made suit.
segments.cn: 我想定制一套西装。

segments.en: Excellent.
segments.cn: 很好。

segments.en: We have the finest cashmeres at affordable prices.
segments.cn: 我们有最优质的羊绒，价格合理。

segments.en: How about we get you measured?
segments.cn: 我们来给你量尺寸吧？

segments.en: Let's start off by measuring the width of your shoulders.
segments.cn: 首先测量你的肩宽。

segments.en: Now let's measure the length of your arms and this bit around your neck here.
segments.cn: 现在测量你的手臂长度和脖子周围的这部分。

segments.en: Can you make sure you leave a little extra space in the collar?
segments.cn: 你能确保领口留一点额外空间吗？

segments.en: My neck gets easily irritated.
segments.cn: 我的脖子容易过敏。

segments.en: No problem.
segments.cn: 没问题。

segments.en: Now for your pants.
segments.cn: 现在测量你的裤子。

segments.en: Let me just measure your waist and the inseam.
segments.cn: 让我先测量你的腰围和内缝。

segments.en: You might also want to leave a little extra room in the waist area.
segments.cn: 你可能还想在腰部留一点额外空间。

segments.en: I tend to gain a few pounds over the holidays.
segments.cn: 我假期期间通常会长几磅。

segments.en: Okay, now you can pick your fabric and pattern design.
segments.cn: 好的，现在你可以选择你的面料和图案设计。

segments.en: Please follow me.
segments.cn: 请跟我来。

segments.en: So this reminds me of something that people used to do a lot more often.
segments.cn: 这让我想起人们以前更常做的事情。

segments.en: So you go to the tailor and you'd have some clothes made.
segments.cn: 你去裁缝那里定制衣服。

segments.en: Most people don't do this anymore.
segments.cn: 大多数人现在不再这样做了。

segments.en: Yeah, well it's actually really interesting.
segments.cn: 是的，实际上这很有趣。

segments.en: Maybe because it's more expensive nowadays or tailors are harder to find.
segments.cn: 也许是因为现在更贵，或者裁缝更难找。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So let's learn about the words first and what they mean and then maybe we can talk about this at the end of today's show.
segments.cn: 所以我们先了解一下这些词及其含义，然后也许可以在今天节目的最后讨论一下。

segments.en: Alright, so today on Language Takeaway we have a word that is a noun and a verb.
segments.cn: 好的，今天的语言收获中我们有一个名词和动词。

segments.en: So as you mentioned, the person that makes suits is a tailor.
segments.cn: 正如你提到的，制作西装的人是裁缝。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: You can say, my uncle is a tailor.
segments.cn: 你可以说，我的叔叔是裁缝。

segments.en: He makes clothes for famous people.
segments.cn: 他为名人制作衣服。

segments.en: But this word is also a verb.
segments.cn: 但这个词也是一个动词。

segments.en: That means it's an action word.
segments.cn: 这意味着它是一个动作词。

segments.en: We can say, my uncle, the tailor, he tailors clothes.
segments.cn: 我们可以说，我的叔叔，裁缝，他定制衣服。

segments.en: Okay, so two tailor clothes.
segments.cn: 好的，所以定制衣服。

segments.en: And what does it mean when you say to tailor?
segments.cn: 那么“定制”是什么意思呢？

segments.en: Well, it can have two meanings.
segments.cn: 嗯，它可以有两个意思。

segments.en: The first is what we learn about in today's dialogue.
segments.cn: 第一个是我们在今天的对话中学到的。

segments.en: It means to make clothes.
segments.cn: 它意味着制作衣服。

segments.en: So to make a shirt or to make a pair of pants.
segments.cn: 比如制作一件衬衫或一条裤子。

segments.en: But these days we often say to tailor, which means to fix something.
segments.cn: 但现在我们常说“定制”，这意味着修理某物。

segments.en: So for example, Marco, if you buy a pair of pants and they're too long, you can have them tailored.
segments.cn: 例如，Marco，如果你买了一条裤子，太长了，你可以让它定制。

segments.en: Have them tailored.
segments.cn: 让它定制。

segments.en: And that means that I am going to have them fixed so they fit me properly.
segments.cn: 这意味着我将让它修理，以便它适合我。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: This is a lot more common right now.
segments.cn: 这现在更常见。

segments.en: Okay, so we're going to be tailoring clothes.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我们将定制衣服。

segments.en: Now, if any of you have ever been to the tailor, what they do is they measure you.
segments.cn: 现在，如果你们中有谁去过裁缝，他们会给你量尺寸。

segments.en: And what do they measure?
segments.cn: 他们测量什么？

segments.en: Well, in this case, they get the width of your shoulders.
segments.cn: 嗯，在这种情况下，他们会测量你的肩宽。

segments.en: What's really great about these upcoming words is that they're useful in math as well, math and basic measurements.
segments.cn: 接下来要介绍的词非常棒，因为它们在数学和基本测量中也很有用。

segments.en: So width is how big something is across.
segments.cn: 所以宽度是某物横向的大小。

segments.en: Across, how wide something is.
segments.cn: 横向，某物的宽度。

segments.en: Exactly, wide width.
segments.cn: 没错，宽度。

segments.en: Okay, so that's the width.
segments.cn: 好的，所以这是宽度。

segments.en: Now, your shoulders, they are wide.
segments.cn: 现在，你的肩膀是宽的。

segments.en: And well, your legs, on the other hand, your legs and arms, you don't measure the width.
segments.cn: 而你的腿，另一方面，腿和手臂，你不测量宽度。

segments.en: Usually you measure the length.
segments.cn: 通常你测量长度。

segments.en: How long they are.
segments.cn: 它们有多长。

segments.en: Okay, so width and length.
segments.cn: 好的，所以宽度和长度。

segments.en: Now, just to throw it in there, this wasn't in the dialogue, but what would be the other measure word?
segments.cn: 现在，顺便提一下，这在对话中没有提到，但另一个测量词是什么？

segments.en: So the third word would be height.
segments.cn: 所以第三个词是高度。

segments.en: So you think of a rectangle, you have the width, how wide something is, the length, how long it is, and the height, how tall it is.
segments.cn: 所以你想象一个矩形，你有宽度，某物的宽度，长度，某物的长度，以及高度，某物的高度。

segments.en: How tall it is, right.
segments.cn: 它有多高，对吧。

segments.en: So width, length, and height.
segments.cn: 所以宽度、长度和高度。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Now that we've measured our arms and legs, now we want to measure our waist.
segments.cn: 现在我们测量了手臂和腿，现在我们想测量腰围。

segments.en: Okay, this is the important one.
segments.cn: 好的，这是重要的。

segments.en: This is also the sensitive one.
segments.cn: 这也是敏感的。

segments.en: If you find that you've gained some weight, we measure the waist.
segments.cn: 如果你发现自己长了点体重，我们测量腰围。

segments.en: Okay, that's how big you are around your stomach.
segments.cn: 好的，这就是你肚子的大小。

segments.en: And so usually we measure this in a circle.
segments.cn: 通常我们以圆形来测量。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Okay, so you've heard of a 26 inch waist or a 32 inch waist.
segments.cn: 好的，所以你听说过26英寸的腰围或32英寸的腰围。

segments.en: This is the size of your stomach.
segments.cn: 这是你肚子的大小。

segments.en: Okay, so it's just above your hips, right?
segments.cn: 好的，所以就在你的臀部上方，对吗？

segments.en: As you say, it's your stomach.
segments.cn: 正如你所说，这是你的肚子。

segments.en: And well, we've measured the waist.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们已经测量了腰围。

segments.en: And now in men especially, they measure the inseam.
segments.cn: 现在，尤其是男性，他们测量裤内缝。

segments.en: Now this is very particular for tailors and having suits made.
segments.cn: 这对裁缝和定制西装来说非常重要。

segments.en: What is the inseam of your pants?
segments.cn: 你的裤子内缝是多少？

segments.en: Well, think of the word in, inside.
segments.cn: 嗯，想想“内”的意思。

segments.en: This is the inside of your pants.
segments.cn: 这是你裤子的内部。

segments.en: So from your foot to the middle of your pants where your zipper starts.
segments.cn: 从你的脚到裤子中间拉链开始的地方。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So that's not the outside length.
segments.cn: 所以这不是外部长度。

segments.en: It's the inside length.
segments.cn: 这是内部长度。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Now, for example, skirts, they don't have inseams, right?
segments.cn: 例如，裙子没有内缝，对吧？

segments.en: No, because there's no inside, there's no middle, right?
segments.cn: 不，因为没有内部，没有中间，对吧？

segments.en: So it's just like a circle.
segments.cn: 所以它就像一个圆。

segments.en: Okay, but in pants or shorts, you have an inseam.
segments.cn: 好的，但在裤子或短裤中，你有内缝。

segments.en: That's, that's where it's connected in the middle.
segments.cn: 那是它在中间连接的地方。

segments.en: Alright, so also in shorts, very interesting.
segments.cn: 好吧，短裤也很有趣。

segments.en: So you can measure the inseam of pants or shorts.
segments.cn: 所以你可以测量裤子或短裤的内缝。

segments.en: Alright, so very interesting and particular words for tailors.
segments.cn: 好吧，这对裁缝来说是非常有趣和特别的词。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to our dialogue again?
segments.cn: 我们再听一遍对话好吗？

segments.en: And we'll be back shortly.
segments.cn: 我们很快就回来。

segments.en: Welcome to Bill's Fabric World.
segments.cn: 欢迎来到比尔的面料世界。

segments.en: What can I do for you today?
segments.cn: 今天我能为你做些什么？

segments.en: I was wondering if you guys also tailor clothes?
segments.cn: 我想知道你们是否也做衣服定制？

segments.en: Sure we do.
segments.cn: 当然可以。

segments.en: We have the best tailors in the country.
segments.cn: 我们有全国最好的裁缝。

segments.en: What is it that you need exactly?
segments.cn: 你具体需要什么？

segments.en: Well, I'm looking to get a custom made suit.
segments.cn: 嗯，我想定制一套西装。

segments.en: Excellent.
segments.cn: 很好。

segments.en: We have the finest cashmere at affordable prices.
segments.cn: 我们有最优质的羊绒，价格合理。

segments.en: How about we get you measured?
segments.cn: 我们来给你测量一下吧？

segments.en: Let's start off by measuring the width of your shoulders.
segments.cn: 先测量一下你的肩宽。

segments.en: Now let's measure the length of your arms and this bit around your neck here.
segments.cn: 现在测量一下你的手臂长度和脖子周围的部分。

segments.en: Can you make sure you leave a little extra space in the collar?
segments.cn: 你能确保领口留一点额外空间吗？

segments.en: My neck gets easily irritated.
segments.cn: 我的脖子容易过敏。

segments.en: No problem.
segments.cn: 没问题。

segments.en: Now for your pants.
segments.cn: 现在测量你的裤子。

segments.en: Let me just measure your waist and the inseam.
segments.cn: 让我测量一下你的腰围和内缝。

segments.en: You might also want to leave a little extra room in the waist area.
segments.cn: 你可能还想在腰部留一点额外空间。

segments.en: I tend to gain a few pounds over the holidays.
segments.cn: 我假期期间会长几磅。

segments.en: Okay, now you can pick your fabric and pattern design.
segments.cn: 好的，现在你可以选择你的面料和图案设计。

segments.en: Please follow me.
segments.cn: 请跟我来。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了。

segments.en: So now we have three key phrases that we found in this dialogue.
segments.cn: 现在我们在这个对话中找到了三个关键短语。

segments.en: So let's take a look at them now in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 让我们现在在流利度构建器中看看它们。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 流利度构建器。

segments.en: This first phrase is the topic of today's lesson.
segments.cn: 第一个短语是今天课程的主题。

segments.en: Well, we talked a little bit about measurements for a suit, but in particular, we're getting a custom made suit.
segments.cn: 嗯，我们稍微谈了一下西装的测量，但特别是我们在定制西装。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So this word custom made.
segments.cn: 所以这个词“定制”。

segments.en: Well, custom is important.
segments.cn: 嗯，定制很重要。

segments.en: It means special or unique.
segments.cn: 它意味着特别或独特。

segments.en: There's no other like it.
segments.cn: 没有其他的像它。

segments.en: So we can talk about custom cars.
segments.cn: 所以我们可以谈论定制汽车。

segments.en: That means a car that has been fixed especially for you.
segments.cn: 这意味着一辆特别为你修理的车。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So a custom made suit would be a suit that was made specifically for your height for how big your waist is etc.
segments.cn: 所以定制西装就是专门为你的身高、腰围等量身定做的西装。

segments.en: specifically for you.
segments.cn: 专门为你。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So a suit that I buy at the department store is just a normal suit, but a suit that I have made for me is a custom made suit.
segments.cn: 所以我在百货商店买的西装只是普通西装，但我为自己定做的西装是定制西装。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: And as you said, you can use it for cars, a custom made car or maybe for example, a custom made custom made kitchen.
segments.cn: 正如你所说，你可以用它来形容汽车，定制汽车，或者例如，定制厨房。

segments.en: That means that you get to pick every single part of the kitchen that you want.
segments.cn: 这意味着你可以选择厨房的每一个部分。

segments.en: Many people do that right.
segments.cn: 很多人这样做，对吧？

segments.en: They have custom built or custom made homes.
segments.cn: 他们有定制建造或定制的房屋。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: That's that's always something I've wanted to do, but I hear that it's much more expensive than getting a normal homemade.
segments.cn: 这是我一直想做的事情，但我听说这比普通的自建房要贵得多。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: So that's the first key phrase.
segments.cn: 所以这是第一个关键短语。

segments.en: Now moving on.
segments.cn: 现在继续。

segments.en: When we talk about measuring, we say I measured.
segments.cn: 当我们谈论测量时，我们说我测量了。

segments.en: I measured the length of this street.
segments.cn: 我测量了这条街的长度。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: Or let's measure you so we can see how big you are.
segments.cn: 或者我们来测量一下你，看看你有多大。

segments.en: But if you notice in the dialogue, we use the passive voice.
segments.cn: 但如果你注意到对话中，我们使用了被动语态。

segments.en: He says, let's get you measured.
segments.cn: 他说，让我们给你测量一下。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: I got measured or it got measured.
segments.cn: 我被测量了，或者它被测量了。

segments.en: To get measured, as you say, is the passive voice.
segments.cn: 被测量，正如你所说，是被动语态。

segments.en: Now, what's the difference between passive and active?
segments.cn: 那么，被动和主动之间有什么区别？

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: So basically what happens here is we are concentrating on the person and the action falling upon you, for example.
segments.cn: 所以基本上这里发生的事情是我们集中在这个人和动作落在你身上，例如。

segments.en: So I got measured.
segments.cn: 所以我被测量了。

segments.en: What happened to me?
segments.cn: 发生在我身上什么？

segments.en: I got measured.
segments.cn: 我被测量了。

segments.en: Who did it?
segments.cn: 谁做的？

segments.en: Who measured you?
segments.cn: 谁测量了你？

segments.en: We don't know.
segments.cn: 我们不知道。

segments.en: We don't know.
segments.cn: 我们不知道。

segments.en: We don't care.
segments.cn: 我们不在乎。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: The point, the important part is that you were measured.
segments.cn: 重点，重要的部分是你被测量了。

segments.en: You got measured.
segments.cn: 你被测量了。

segments.en: We could have a different phrase.
segments.cn: 我们可以有不同的短语。

segments.en: We say, for example, I will measure this table or he measures the height of the door.
segments.cn: 我们说，例如，我将测量这张桌子，或者他测量门的高度。

segments.en: And we know he measures.
segments.cn: 我们知道他在测量。

segments.en: I will measure.
segments.cn: 我将测量。

segments.en: We know who the actor is.
segments.cn: 我们知道谁是行动者。

segments.en: That means it's active voice because the focus is on who's doing this action.
segments.cn: 这意味着这是主动语态，因为重点在于谁在做这个动作。

segments.en: But in passive voice, the important thing is who is receiving the action.
segments.cn: 但在被动语态中，重要的是谁在接受这个动作。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: Now it's a little bit complicated because as you can see, measured is in the past, but we're not really talking about the past.
segments.cn: 现在有点复杂，因为如你所见，测量是过去式，但我们并不真正谈论过去。

segments.en: So it may get a little bit complicated.
segments.cn: 所以可能会有点复杂。

segments.en: We can take a more in-depth look at that in the community section.
segments.cn: 我们可以在社区部分更深入地探讨这个问题。

segments.en: You can ask a couple of questions.
segments.cn: 你可以问几个问题。

segments.en: We'll place a couple of examples, but it's kind of hard to get into the grammar over an audio podcast.
segments.cn: 我们会提供几个例子，但在音频播客中讨论语法有点困难。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: That's true.
segments.cn: 这是真的。

segments.en: So that's why we have the practice space on the website.
segments.cn: 所以这就是我们在网站上设立练习空间的原因。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Now moving on, we have our last phrase.
segments.cn: 现在继续，我们有最后一句话。

segments.en: And when he was talking about the waste and how he should leave a little bit of extra room, it's because he tends, he tends to gain a few pounds.
segments.cn: 当他谈到浪费以及他应该留一点额外空间时，是因为他倾向于增加几磅。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So to gain a few pounds is like gaining a kilo.
segments.cn: 增加几磅就像增加一公斤。

segments.en: It means to gain weight over the holidays.
segments.cn: 这意味着在假期期间增加体重。

segments.en: And in this case, to tend to, I tend to means I normally or I usually.
segments.cn: 在这种情况下，倾向于，我倾向于意味着我通常或我通常。

segments.en: So for example, Marco, what do you tend to eat for breakfast?
segments.cn: 例如，马尔科，你早餐通常吃什么？

segments.en: I tend to eat scrambled eggs and a glass of yogurt.
segments.cn: 我通常吃炒鸡蛋和一杯酸奶。

segments.en: That's healthy.
segments.cn: 这很健康。

segments.en: Do you tend to run late in the morning?
segments.cn: 你早上通常会迟到吗？

segments.en: Yes.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: True.
segments.cn: 真的。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So tend to, it's a tendency is what usually happens.
segments.cn: 所以倾向于，这是一种倾向，通常发生的事情。

segments.en: It's normal.
segments.cn: 这是正常的。

segments.en: It's normal.
segments.cn: 这是正常的。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So very interesting phrases, very interesting words.
segments.cn: 所以非常有趣的短语，非常有趣的词。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to our dialogue for the last time?
segments.cn: 我们为什么不再听一次我们的对话呢？

segments.en: Welcome to Bill's Fabric World.
segments.cn: 欢迎来到比尔的面料世界。

segments.en: What can I do for you today?
segments.cn: 今天我能为你做些什么？

segments.en: I was wondering if you guys also tailor clothes.
segments.cn: 我想知道你们是否也做定制服装。

segments.en: Sure we do.
segments.cn: 当然可以。

segments.en: We have the best tailors in the country.
segments.cn: 我们有全国最好的裁缝。

segments.en: What is it that you need exactly?
segments.cn: 你具体需要什么？

segments.en: Well, I'm looking to get a custom made suit.
segments.cn: 嗯，我想定做一套西装。

segments.en: Excellent.
segments.cn: 很好。

segments.en: We have the finest cash mirrors at affordable prices.
segments.cn: 我们有最优质的面料，价格合理。

segments.en: How about we get you measured?
segments.cn: 我们来给你测量一下吧？

segments.en: Let's start off by measuring the width of your shoulders.
segments.cn: 让我们先测量一下你的肩宽。

segments.en: Now let's measure the length of your arms and this bit around your neck here.
segments.cn: 现在让我们测量一下你的手臂长度和脖子周围的部分。

segments.en: Can you make sure you leave a little extra space in the collar?
segments.cn: 你能确保在领口留一点额外空间吗？

segments.en: My neck gets easily irritated.
segments.cn: 我的脖子容易发炎。

segments.en: No problem.
segments.cn: 没问题。

segments.en: Now for your pants.
segments.cn: 现在测量你的裤子。

segments.en: Let me just measure your waist and the inseam.
segments.cn: 让我测量一下你的腰围和内缝。

segments.en: You might also want to leave a little extra room in the waist area.
segments.cn: 你可能还想在腰部区域留一点额外空间。

segments.en: I tend to gain a few pounds over the holidays.
segments.cn: 我在假期期间倾向于增加几磅。

segments.en: Okay, now you can pick your fabric and pattern design.
segments.cn: 好的，现在你可以选择你的面料和图案设计。

segments.en: Please follow me.
segments.cn: 请跟我来。

segments.en: All right, so we talked earlier about how most people buy their clothes at a department store or a clothing store.
segments.cn: 好的，我们之前谈到大多数人是在百货商店或服装店购买衣服。

segments.en: Have you seen much of this?
segments.cn: 你见过很多这种情况吗？

segments.en: You know maybe back in Ecuador it's more common than in America.
segments.cn: 你知道，也许在厄瓜多尔这比在美国更常见。

segments.en: Yeah, usually people just go to a department store and get suits for example, but it's actually very common as well because it's kind of in their artisans to be like a shoemaker or to be a tailor.
segments.cn: 是的，通常人们只是去百货商店买西装，但实际上这也很常见，因为他们的工匠通常是鞋匠或裁缝。

segments.en: So actually people like it more and go to tailors because they kind of become renowned like, oh he used to make suits for the president.
segments.cn: 所以实际上人们更喜欢去裁缝那里，因为他们会变得有名，比如“哦，他曾为总统做过西装”。

segments.en: So you know people really really like to get suits made there and obviously they fit much better.
segments.cn: 所以你知道人们真的很喜欢在那里定制西装，显然它们的合身度更好。

segments.en: You feel more comfortable.
segments.cn: 你会感觉更舒适。

segments.en: And you look better.
segments.cn: 而且看起来更好。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: As I've said before you know I see people who who buy all these suits.
segments.cn: 正如我之前所说，我看到那些买了所有这些西装的人。

segments.en: My brother for example he never quite fit right.
segments.cn: 例如，我的兄弟，他的西装总是合不太好。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: You can tell it's a little too big in the shoulders.
segments.cn: 你可以看出肩部有点大。

segments.en: My brother's tall so his his pants are always a little bit too short.
segments.cn: 我兄弟个子高，所以他的裤子总是有点短。

segments.en: But when you come to a place like China and most people can get these these suits made for them they just look fabulous.
segments.cn: 但当你来到像中国这样的地方，大多数人可以定制这些西装时，它们看起来真的很棒。

segments.en: It looks very very nice.
segments.cn: 看起来非常好。

segments.en: Yeah, so maybe you guys can tell us if you've ever had anything tailor-made.
segments.cn: 是的，所以也许你们可以告诉我们你们是否曾经定制过任何东西。

segments.en: Not only guys suits but girls also get tailor-made dresses, tailor-made blouses.
segments.cn: 不仅是男士西装，女士也会定制裙子、定制衬衫。

segments.en: I always get coats made actually because my shoulders are broad and so it's hard for me to find coats that fit right but if I get one custom made it looks really good.
segments.cn: 我实际上总是定制外套，因为我的肩膀宽，所以很难找到合适的外套，但如果我定制一件，它看起来真的很好。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So come to our website EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 所以请访问我们的网站 EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: Leave your questions and comments there and we'll see you guys later.
segments.cn: 在那里留下你的问题和评论，我们下次再见。

segments.en: Until next time guys.
segments.cn: 下次见，大家。

segments.en: Bye-bye.
segments.cn: 再见。
